phases.tip: One-time tasks that you can verify. Similar to traditional functional requirements or user stories.
phases.name: Requirements
phases.description: Application security requirements, generally used to assist requirements analysts.

phases.tip: Principles or other tasks that you can’t verify with testing.
phases.name: Architecture & Design
phases.description: Design advice on how to build secure applications, generally used to assist architects & lead developers.

phases.tip: Cross-cutting tasks / coding standards that occur in multiple places throughout the application.
phases.name: Development
phases.description: Secure development tasks, generally used to assist developers.

phases.tip: Tasks that verify the absence or presence of requirements or development tasks through runtime testing.
phases.name: Testing
phases.description: Step by step testing instructions for security vulnerabilities, generally used to assist software Quality Assurance (QA) testers.
